reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Programme for Institutional Cooperation between Higher Education Institutions (HEI ICI)

description.narrative: The long-term objective of the HEI ICI programme is to strengthen the performance of higher education institutions in the global south to support their ability to participate in the development of a stable functioning and egalitarian society. This aim will be reached through building competences based on local regional and national development needs and thus contributing to reduction of extreme poverty. The programme supports widely the Finland's development cooperation priority sectors; Improving the posit ion of women and girls Supporting the democratic character and proper functioning of societies Promoting sustainable solutions in energy production and food and water supply and Reinforcing the private sector and employment. Through investing in research a nd education is seen as investment in the long run for the developing of steady active and equal society. HEI ICI programme contributes HEIs participation in building stable efficient and equitable societies by enhancing human capacities for their own deve lopment needs. Beneficiaries are the students and teachers in Southern higher education institutions who will benefit for improved quality of teaching access on information and services.

Through investing in research a nd education is seen as investment in the long run for the developing of steady active and equal society. tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Improving food security, access to water and sustainability is the secondary priority area in t his activity
